skill.name: clinpgx-database
skill.description: Access ClinPGx pharmacogenomics data (successor to PharmGKB). Query gene-drug interactions, CPIC guidelines, allele functions, for precision medicine and genotype-guided dosing decisions.
skill.summary: Access ClinPGx pharmacogenomics data (successor to PharmGKB). Query gene-drug interactions, CPIC gui...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: All 376 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The skill is a legitimate pharmacogenomics database API client accessing the public ClinPGx API (api.clinpgx.org). The static analyzer misidentified Markdown code fences (using backticks) as shell command execution, gene function descriptions as cryptographic algorithms, and clinical decision support tool references as system reconnaissance. Network calls are to a known public API, file writes are for caching API results, and there is no malicious code present.

content.value_statement: Access ClinPGx to retrieve pharmacogenomics data including gene-drug interactions, CPIC guidelines, and allele function information. This skill supports precision medicine by providing clinical decision support for genotype-guided medication dosing.
actual_capabilities: Query gene information for pharmacogenes like CYP2D6, CYP2C19, and TPMT
Retrieve drug information with pharmacogenomic annotations
Access CPIC clinical practice guidelines for gene-drug pairs
Get allele function, phenotype, and population frequency data
Query clinical annotations filtered by evidence level
Search drug labels for pharmacogenomic testing recommendations
limitations: Rate limited to 2 requests per second (enforced by API)
Authentication required for substantial API use (contact api@clinpgx.org)
Clinical decisions should always be verified against primary sources

use_cases.title: Review Patient Medications
use_cases.description: Check patient genotypes against prescribed medications to identify drug-gene interactions requiring dose adjustment.

use_cases.title: Analyze Gene-Drug Evidence
use_cases.description: Query clinical annotations and CPIC guidelines to support pharmacogenomics research studies.

use_cases.title: Build PGx Applications
use_cases.description: Integrate ClinPGx API into electronic health records or clinical decision support systems.

prompt_templates.title: Gene Lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the ClinPGx skill to find information about the CYP2D6 gene including its function and related drugs.

prompt_templates.title: Drug Interactions
prompt_templates.prompt: Query ClinPGx for all gene-drug pairs involving clopidogrel and CYP2C19 with CPIC guideline information.

prompt_templates.title: Clinical Guidelines
prompt_templates.prompt: Get the CPIC guideline recommendations for codeine prescribing based on CYP2D6 metabolizer status.

prompt_templates.title: Allele Frequencies
prompt_templates.prompt: Find allele frequency data for CYP2D6 across European, African, and East Asian populations.

output_examples.input: Get information about the CYP2C19 gene and its relationship with clopidogrel
output: CYP2C19 is a cytochrome P450 enzyme involved in drug metabolism
CYP2C19-clopidogrel pair has CPIC Level A recommendation
Poor metabolizers should receive alternative antiplatelet therapy

output_examples.input: What are the CPIC guidelines for warfarin dosing based on CYP2C9 genotype?
output: CPIC provides genotype-guided warfarin dosing recommendations
CYP2C9*2 and *3 alleles are associated with reduced enzyme activity
Patients with reduced function alleles require lower warfarin doses
VKORC1 genotype also influences dosing requirements

output_examples.input: Find all clinically actionable pharmacogenes with CPIC Level A recommendations
output: DPYD-fluoropyrimidines (dose adjustment based on activity score)

best_practices: Always implement rate limiting (0.5 second delay) when making API calls to respect the 2 req/sec limit
Cache frequently accessed data locally to reduce API calls and improve performance
Verify clinical decisions against primary sources like CPIC guidelines and FDA drug labels
anti_patterns: Do not make clinical decisions based solely on API results without verifying against primary sources
Do not exceed the API rate limit as this will result in HTTP 429 errors
Do not hardcode sensitive credentials in client code when substantial API use requires authentication

faq.question: What is ClinPGx?
faq.answer: ClinPGx is a comprehensive pharmacogenomics database that consolidates data from PharmGKB, CPIC, and PharmCAT for clinical use.

faq.question: Is authentication required?
faq.answer: No authentication is required for basic API access. Contact api@clinpgx.org for substantial use.

faq.question: What rate limits apply?
faq.answer: The API allows a maximum of 2 requests per second. Implement 500ms delay between requests.

faq.question: What genes are covered?
faq.answer: Key pharmacogenes include CYP450 enzymes (CYP2D6, CYP2C19, CYP2C9), transporters (SLCO1B1), and others like TPMT and DPYD.

faq.question: What evidence levels are available?
faq.answer: Evidence levels range from 1A (CPIC/FDA guideline) to Level 4 (case reports), with 1A being highest quality.

faq.question: Can this be used for clinical decisions?
faq.answer: The skill provides data for research and decision support. Always verify clinical decisions against primary sources.
